title: How can I move the data from my TB installation on Windows to a new TB installation on Mac?
content:
I'd hoped this question was answered at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer, but that article assumes a Mac-to-Mac migration, and it doesn't work for a Windows-to-Mac migration. The discussion at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1324908 addresses the issue, but what the poster did to get things working is rather vague ("I took more from one [response] and a little from the other two...]. Can someone please summarize or point me to a summary of what needs to be done to move the files in a TB installation on Windows 10 to MacOS 14 Sonoma so that the installation on the Mac will work like the one on Windows did?

I have a lot of old mail, so my TB directory is over 40 GB. Copying it from my Windows machine to my Mac (either over a network or via a USB drive) takes quite a while, so I'm trying to avoid any more trial and error than I've already gone through.

Thanks.

PS - I apologize for the use of raw URLs above, but I was unable to figure out Mozilla's markup language, and there's no preview button for posts, so I decided to go with something I figured was unlikely to get mangled in the publication process.
creator: LangfristigerFFUser

title: Login
content: I setup my account, but I keep getting a message - Login to server outlook.office365.com with username waynec67@outlook.com failed. How do I fix this?
creator: waynec67

title: composition font
content: after cloning my old disk to a bigger one I cannot change composition font - it is stuck on bold. Previously I was able to switch between bold-underline-italic. Suggestions/recommendations highly appreciated... Rad.
creator: Radan

title: thunderbird 115.4.2
content:
I am having 3 different issues.

In version 115.4.2 the drafts folder repopulates itself with messages from my sent box randomly as it sees fit. I have to keep deleting them. Is there a fix for that?

I despise the accordion title pull down.s in the inbox and sent folders. I want to have my replies listed as a single message. Can I unset that despicable feature or do I have to back date to some other version. If so, which one?

Believe it or not, I was using thunderbird version 2.x.x but was forced to upgrade because Spectrum internet provider switched from pop mail to imap. What is the first version (older than 115) that allows imap.
creator: ranleigh.wylde

title: vanishing sub folders under local folders
content: Sub folders and their emails under local folders in 115.9.0 have vanished. How do i retrieve them?
creator: gbohatch
